intro: Alseodaphne longipes, commonly known as the long-fruited sandalwood, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, including parts of Indonesia and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its aromatic, rough-textured bark and lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, clustered flowers followed by elliptical, woody fruits. Alseodaphne longipes is often found in lowland and hill forest areas, thriving in humid, tropical climates.
